Heya,

> Yep, it's me (Tom) again, with another thought...
>
> >Doing it as a group style project is great, if you want it open-source
there
> >are more than a few websites that can provide a central storage location
for
> >it.
> >I'd suggest though that a small number of people work on it, rather than
> >some giant group - the program itself won't be some mamoth thing and the
> >fewer programmers working on it the more they know the code and the
faster
> >things get implemented/fixed/etc.  Of course this implies that the
> >programmers have lots of time to work on it :)
> >
> >As for the language to use, I recommend C++.
> >You don't need to use MS Visual C++ for it, thats only the IDE.  Using
> >standard C++ means it will then be compileable on a wide range of
compilers.
> >I take it the editor will be a native Win32 application, which just means
> >that anyone without MVC++ will need the windows platform SDK and set it
up -
> >no big hassle, I know at least one free compiler (DJGPP) that runs in
both
> >DOS and Windows that can do it.
>
> Although we can't release the entire project for free (due to contracts we
> have with places still selling Gladiator, etc), I'd have no objections at
> all to letting any of you take blocks of the code -- especially things
like
> parts of the scenario editor, etc. -- if it would help.  Obviously you'd
> probably want to re-code it, but I know that having the source there in
> front of you can often help.  So, if that would be at all useful, let me
> know and I can provide it.

That's great, once the group starts working on it I'm sure they'll have bits
and pieces they'll want :)

Thanks for all your help Tom!

Now someone should gather all the info we've got and put it somewhere
central :)

Cya's,
Deathifier
